captions.text: On this episode of Roadkill we trade a 600 horsepower Chevy truck
for a Volkswagen with a busted door.
I think he's enjoying that too much now.

The muscle truck is a 1974 Chevy that
you first saw in episode 18
of Roadkill. It's powered by an all-aluminum LS6 it has a turbo 400
automatic transmission,
a Gear Vendors overdrive and a 49-inch wren with 5-13 gears.

The thing that changed about the muscle
truck since the last time you saw it?
That's right the FI. This is MSD atomic self-learning EFI it's supposed
to be a real
simple deal so far it's running good. We're impressed so far.

off-road.

comments.text:
Why did you trash those fenders? There are people in the rust belt that 
would trade you their rusty fenders that require minimal work because time 
already did most of the work for you, for those mint ones including paying 
the shipping both ways, and might even pay more on top of that for them. 
What a waste I hate that kind of crap. You had to "decide" whether to 
unbolt the fenders for clearance or cut them, the choice is so clear there 
is no choice, take the damn fenders off.﻿
